reviews.review:
I can't recommend Portal 2 enough, it's such a GREAT game! Minds your blow away... sorry, blows your mind away! (see, mine is already gone!)

That said, you should play Portal 1 first, otherwise you might not understand all the strained relationship between GLaDOS and Chell.
Buy it. Unless you are short on cash. Wait, no. Buy it anyway.

An excellent revisit by Valve Software. Following a more traditional 3-act structure, this game answers questions about Aperture's (and GlaDoS') origins, introduces many new mechanics for players to master, and has about triple the length of the original game (more if you get stuck on some of the puzzles, like I did). My only complaint would have to be that aid isn't provided on some of the hardest puzzles in the game regardless of how long you are stuck there; while the original game shared this, the puzzles were debatably easier. Additionally, it's effectively a one-trick pony: once completed, you really have no reason to come back. That being said, it is an excellent game, though probably not deserving of fifty dollars.

A worthy successor to the original. The writing is excellent, the puzzles are fun and the graphics are beautiful. You're going to love the new characters and revelations! The co-op is entertaining too, especially if you have a buddy who hasn't completed the campaign yet either.
Best puzzle game ever, with an epic storyline.
絕讚的遊戲性與黑色幽默 還有深藏在線索後的感人劇情

ABSOLUTELY LOVED THIS GAME!!! 

Graphics are phenominal camera angels are amazing and most imporantly gameplay and story was the best! 

If you love a hardcore stratergy game with a slight bit of humor on the side this is the top game for that!

Perhaps one of the most glorious puzzle games of the century. And I don't even like potatoes! Oh, I might add that the test chambers are a tad easy if you're already familiar with the Portal concept from the first game. Nevertheless an unforgettable game!

Theoretically describable as a First Person Puzzle Game, the level of character and detail put into the game is what really elevates it into an experience.  A perfect demonstration of drawing on the emotional power you get from something like say, reading a book, but all done in the format of an interactive game.

Recommended for EVERYONE.  Though I would also recommend playing through the first game (all very good itself) first.  Not strictly necessary, but it does help in understanding the setting somewhat.

Absolutely a worthy succesor to Portal, stunning new graphics, entrancing music, expanded gameplay and story. I heartily recomend it to everyone who's played Portal. To those who haven't, I say, go buy Portal. Play it. Fall in love with it. Then buy Portal 2 . Wash, rinse, repeat.

Saw the menu screen, loved it. Started playing, loved it. Great music, fantastic use of sound throught the game. Great single player and multiplayer story. This is why Valve should NOT finish making brilliant single player games.
Most fun game if played in a while ;)
Aside from the jump puzzles, this game is bloody awesome. Definitely worth at least a single playthrough if you played Portal 1.
EPIC. That's all you need to hear. BUY IT.
This game is freaking awesome. Even if you've never played Portal, and you have no idea what half-life is, you should play this before you die.

For the man who has everything and the girl that loves tetris. This is one of the best games of the decade. A first person shooter with no blood, a ton of humor, and loads of puzzle solving.
Dogs may bark, and cats may meow; but Portal is forever, especially now.
This game is amazing. If you have the money you should totally get it. Forget any other game, Portal 2 is the greatest game so far this year.

Ah, I can't put a word bad about this fantasic sequel to a very successful game. Full of comedy and puzzles that will actually make you think, I believe this to be the game of the year 2011.

Portal 2 è il sequel di Portal: un esperimento ottimamente riuscito che ha inventato un nuovo modo di concepire gli fps. Portal 2 riprende le vincende narrate nel capitolo precedente con Chell che ha trascorso centinaia di anni in stasi, dopo che, molto probabilmente, l'umanità si è estinta. Il gameplay è estremamente vario e gli enigmi ben calibrati per non apparire nè troppo semplici nè estremamente incomprensibili; la trama fantastica e ricca di colpi di scena; il costo estremamente contenuto in relazione a quel che offre. Oltre alla modalità in single player(che durerà dalle 8 alle 12 ore), c'è una fantastica modalità in coop (la cui longevità si attesta sulle 7-10 ore) che vi permetterà di condividere, con un amico, un'esperienza cooperativa senza precedenti. Portal 2 è da ritenere uno dei migliori giochi a cui mi sia dedicato nella mia lunga esperienza da gamer. Qualunque persona che si ritenga un videogiocatore, è obbligata ad acquistare questo irripetibile capolavoro!
Voto 9,5
Splooge.
Stand in a small hallway, pop a portal left and right and go play tag with yourself. You'll never have to be lonely again. [spoiler]:'^([spoiler]7.5/10[/spoiler][/spoiler]

This game is rlly awesome, great to play, great story, all is wonderfull 10*
Trickier puzzles than the first Portal, but still brilliant gameplay nonetheless with an intriguing storyline and fun CO-OP mode to boot. A must have for all!

Mode solo et multi excellent de bout en bout... Valve a réussi à faire de la suite d'un jeu qui était devenu culte « par surprise », un jeu encore plus culte.

Un des meilleurs jeux de 2011.

You NEED this game!
Portal 2 is one of the most epic games ever!

It is much longer than Portal, the plot is even more amazing.
All the characters have such colourful personalities even though most of them are robots/AI and the voice acting is brilliant, especially Stephen Merchant who voices Wheatley. 

The puzzles are fun and challenging, but not too challenging that it is frustrating. 
The co-op game mode looks enjoyable from watching Youtube videos of people playing it and I hope to play it too sometime. 

So yeah... get it when possible. 
Preferably before you die. :3

Smart writing combined with witty humour and brilliant voice work made this THE funniest game I've ever played. The characters are colorful and endearing, the puzzles are creative and rewarding, and Valve's attention to detail is evident everywhere you look. The coop elements are refreshingly fun and innovative as well.

Overall, this is my favorite Valve game to date. And that's quite something, coming from a Valve fanboy like me. =)
Masterpiece.
PC Gamer declared it the "Best game of 2011" only a third through the year, and within 12 hours of it's release. WTF?!?!

Well, even if you haven't had a chance to play the original one this is a spectacular game. It's long and challenging at times, but you'll figure out things eventually. Must have for anyone who needs a break from your usual game..
Awsome fun. Awsome campaign and co-op. But it isnt replayable, except for trying to get some of the harder achievements. I hope we get some free DLC =)

Brilliant from start to finish, Portal 2 takes the series beyond it's predecessor and into new territory as it expands on the story and gameplay in wide areas. The story takes the characters further with added addition of new and exciting characters and the gameplay has been expanded with many more gameplay elements including Gel, light bridges and Tractor beams. In addittion to this its co-op mode continues after the main game has ended and is insane fun with a buddy, two portals each equal four times the madness and of course four times the intricate puzzles. 

Portal 2 expands everything and shows it's predecessor for what it is a student project. With insane puzzles, comedic and entracing characters that seem almost lifelike. It deserves attention and is definatly one of the best games this year.
Why don't you have this yet? I mean, come on...

Portal 2 improved on Portal in so many ways that it should be goty already, it managed to live past the hype and our expectations.  It quadrupled the game length compared to the first game with an extra co-op mode which really does need teamwork and lateral thinking. 

The singleplayer is also a masterpiece, bringing in all the gels and new puzzles with the portal gun into one unified gaming experience, which didn’t feel too cumbersome but still required our brain cells to work out what to do.

 It would be terrible to finish this recommendation without mentioning Wheatley:just amazing voice acting by Stephen Merchant and brought the humour to portal 2 to the next level.

Buy it now!  If you don’t you might as well be in SPAAAAAAAAAAAAAACE!!!!!!!!!
Askul tänkarspel nu med Co-op också :) gillas skarpt
better then the 1st mainly because it's got Co-op woohoo!!!
12 HOUR GAME  fun co op cant wait for the Custom maps
Perfect. Masterpiece. Totally awesome. Instant buy. Worth every penny. It can be called short, but I can't stop replaying it... I'm not sure if I ever going to get bored with this... :D

I was so excited about Portal 2 I was sure it wouldn't meet up to my expectations unless the game literally sucked me into my monitor.

Portal 2 does not disappoint, but it is not what I expected ether. Now that Valve gave the game a load of cash the developers had the freedom to give the game a complexity the original lacked. More characters, a larger story, and far more complex puzzles just to name a few things. For you Portal 1 fans, Portal 2 gives you a back story as well as quite a few scenes that will make you laugh and cry.

At the end of the single player I didn't feel cheated as much as I was disappointed it was over. Then I moved on to COOP and it was like playing Portal 3. Its an entirely new story. However, I would strongly recommend playing with a friend who has a mic. The COOP saves your progress (I believe) and took us about 6-7 hours to complete if your not rushing through it.
Worth the wait, just excellent.

Where Portal was too short, Portal 2 is twice to three times as long. Where Portal was too easy, Portal 2 ramps the difficulty up significantly; especially toward the end. Where Portal had a mediocre soundtrack, Portal 2 makes you want to pause the game and bump the jams.

Portal 2 is the perfect example of what a sequel should be. It addresses all of the issues it had as well as improve on everything that made it great. The great dialogue is here in spades (this is the funniest game ever made, by far) and the wonderful art style is vastly improved and solidified with help from the simply gorgeous graphics. Now throw in some co-op missions and you've just multiplied everything that made Portal great by two. Some of the later co-op levels will leave you crying in frusteration. TAKE SOME FUCKING NOTES FOR DRAGON AGE III, BIOWARE!
Le premier Portal était un OVNI, le 2 est tout simplement une tuerie. Du très grand Valve.

I "totally" recommend this...  :`(

The single player campaign of Portal 2 is excellent, witty and just the right amount of frustrating, I would recommend it to anyone. I can't really comment on the coop because I'm yet to play it but from what I hear I expect to get the same enjoyment as I did playing the campaign.
Very good game full of imagination
This game rules, funny as hell and nice gameplay. MP is fun with friends if you can voicechat.

Seriously one of the best sequels ever. This was a thrilling adventure from start to finish. It was so satisfying to get back in the groove of shooting portals. This time around there's a lot more tools to use for solving puzzles, these add so much more depth and variety to the game. The co-op mode introduces a whole new experience and adds many more hours of entertainment. It's short but it's amazing. Buy it, play it, FOR SCIENCE.
Get bored and try to find a way to sleep while experiencing frefall for much longer then anyone on a planet the size of earth ever should.

Definitly a awsome game, Full of humor yet still capable of challenging the mind and making you think as you go. I loved the first portal and i can honestly say This one is even better then the first. Highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys a game that requires thought.

Portal 2 definitely brings a lot to the Portal equation. For one, the Singleplayer game has been revamped with a whole slew of new puzzles and a bigger story. The puzzle elements have new ways to solve with the lasers, jump pads, funnels, and a favorite, gels or paints from Tag: The Power of Paint. All of these tie in with the portal elements and first types of puzzles and techniques introduced from the first Portal and Narbacular Drop. All of the combination of the new elements to solve and move or to paint or portal makes for an unforgettably fun experience to finish puzzles just like how Portal did it.
The story has been totally added with many twists and changes. The characters Wheatley and GLaDOS are the main characters. While the two seem to go their normals ways, they switch all of a sudden, with your friend being the enemy and your enemy your friend. The support of other characters such as other cores and Cave Johnson are funny just like the two computers.
This game is one of my most favorite games I have ever played!  I love the gameplay, the concepts, and the story really floored me!  10 out of 10!
Game of The Year, Hands Down.
E' meravigliosamente divertente!!! La modalità cooperativa è FANTASTICAAA!!!!!
Just .... awesome, that's all you need to know.
